title: AttributeError: 'Variable' object has no attribute 'MM'
body_html:
• OS: Ubuntu: Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.4.0-1038-aws x86_64)
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.0a0+9ebfece
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): Source
  • Python version: Python 2.7
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: Cuda 9, cuDNN v7
  • GPU models and configuration: Tesla K80
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): gcc version 5.4.0 20160609 (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.5)

A test script for reproducing the error message:

import torch
import torch.legacy.nn as nn
import torchvision
#from torch.legacy.nn import MM

C, H, W = 3, 64, 64
input = torch.randn(C, H, W)
output = torch.randn(C, C)

C, H, W = input.size(0), input.size(1), input.size(2)
x_flat = input.view(C, H * W)
output = output.resize_(C, C)
print(x_flat.t().type())
print(output.type())
output = output.MM(x_flat, x_flat.t())

#https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/45524ec33ce1bf75ece04d4f6eb939ba0c9469e9/torch/legacy/nn/MM.py

The error message:

torch.FloatTensor
torch.FloatTensor
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "t1.py", line 15, in <module>
    output = output.MM(x_flat, x_flat.t())
AttributeError: 'Variable' object has no attribute 'MM'

Am I doing something wrong here? Or did I find a bug? Everything I've tried results in the same error message.

body:
- OS: Ubuntu: Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.4.0-1038-aws x86_64)
- PyTorch version: 0.4.0a0+9ebfece
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): Source
- Python version: Python 2.7
- CUDA/cuDNN version: Cuda 9, cuDNN v7
- GPU models and configuration: Tesla K80        
- GCC version (if compiling from source): gcc version 5.4.0 20160609 (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.5)


A test script for reproducing the error message:

```
import torch
import torch.legacy.nn as nn
import torchvision
#from torch.legacy.nn import MM

C, H, W = 3, 64, 64
input = torch.randn(C, H, W)
output = torch.randn(C, C)

C, H, W = input.size(0), input.size(1), input.size(2)
x_flat = input.view(C, H * W)
output = output.resize_(C, C)
print(x_flat.t().type())
print(output.type())
output = output.MM(x_flat, x_flat.t())

#https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/45524ec33ce1bf75ece04d4f6eb939ba0c9469e9/torch/legacy/nn/MM.py
```

The error message: 

```
torch.FloatTensor
torch.FloatTensor
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "t1.py", line 15, in <module>
    output = output.MM(x_flat, x_flat.t())
AttributeError: 'Variable' object has no attribute 'MM'
```

Am I doing something wrong here? Or did I find a bug? Everything I've tried results in the same error message.
